column4: if I were going to use Ubuntu for a server for games (Halo, Battlefield, ect) should I use regular ubuntu, xubuntu, other..?
I was hoping for something with a GUI interface. I just put the server edition on the computer I plan on using, and have no idea how to work off only command prompts
if you want a desctop manager and don't lose to much resources you should go for xubuntu
but if you don't use is it's better to shutdown the desktopmanager
but you don't have to reinstal
you can install a gui on the server version
unless it's something else than sudo apt-get
the way kindofabuzz told it is ok
, once I install ubuntu-desktop, will it automatically launch at startup? or how do I access it? just type ubuntu-desktop every time I want my GUI interface?
just type 'start x' and it will launch the GUI interface?
and don't run that as sudo
